alert.note: Alert for Wasatch Mountains South of I-80; Western Uinta Mountains (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued March 20 at 9:22PM MDT until March 21 at 3:00AM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 AM MDT TUESDAY... ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 3 PM TUESDAY TO 6 AM MDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...For the first Winter Storm Warning, heavy snow. Additional snow accumulations of up to 2 inches. For the second Winter Storm Warning, heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 12 to 24 inches with locally higher amounts possible in the upper Cottonwoods. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. * WHERE...Wasatch Mountains South of I-80 and Western Uinta Mountains. * WHEN...For the first Winter Storm Warning, until 3 AM MDT Tuesday. For the second Winter Storm Warning, from 3 PM Tuesday to 6 AM MDT Thursday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. For graphical depictions of the snowfall forecast, including Official NWS Forecast, High End Amount, and Low End Amount, visit weather.gov/slc/winter. For winter road conditions from the Utah Department of Transportation, visit http://www.udottraffic.utah.gov/roadweatherforecast.aspx.
